intro: Pomaria lactea, commonly known as the milkweed plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinctive botanical feature. The plant typically has opposite, ovate leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink or white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open fields or along roadsides. Pomaria lactea is also known for its role in supporting monarch butterfly populations.
